issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Not sure if its a platform bug or win 8 bug, but keeping it so that we have it in our database

Description:
1.Connect the BB 10 device to the win 8 machine using a usb cable
2.Make sure you install the blackberry device manager
3.Run an app on device using titanium studio

Actual rssult:
1.It fails to run & gives network is unreachable error

Normally if you install the blackberry device manager it installs the necessary drivers which detects the device.Also,we can only put apps on device if we have this manager installed 

The same steps on win 7 & mac osx 10.8.2 does not have any issues

Expected Results:
1.We should be able to run the app successfully
fields.summary: BlackBerry : Not able to run apps on BlackBerry device on win 8, gives network is unreachable error.
fields.environment:
Environment:
Ti Studio : 3.1.0.201301231719
Ti BB SDK : 3.1.0.v20130131191720
Win 8 
BB simulator : 10.0.9.386

comments.body:
Updating to the latest BB 10 version on the device fixed the issue.
Thus closing the issue.
